    • Field Detail

      • KEY_FILE

        public static final java.lang.String KEY_FILE
        This client property of the JRootPane should map to a java.io.File. This is how this object identifies the File that we're using, and on Macs using this key correctly updates the titlebar of frames.
        See Also:
        Apple Tech Note 2196, Constant Field Values

      • getDocumentFileExtension

        public abstract java.lang.String getDocumentFileExtension()
        Return the document file extension for files this SaveableFrame represents. For example "jpg" or "txt".
        Returns:
        the document file extension for files this SaveableFrame represents.

      • isDocumentDirty

        public abstract boolean isDocumentDirty()
        Returns whether this window contains unsaved changes. This may be called on or off the EDT, so it needs to be fast and thread-safe.
        Returns:
        whether this window contains unsaved changes.

      • saveFile

        public abstract void saveFile(java.io.File f,
                              Cancellable cancellable)
                       throws UserCancelledException,
                              java.lang.Exception
        Save the document this window represents to the argument provided. This should never be called on the EDT, because saving may take an undefined amount of time.
        Parameters:
        f - the file to save to. This should never be null, because that would require prompting the user for a save-as dialog which needs to be handled on the EDT (and this call needs to be off the EDT). This argument may not always be the same as this.getFile(). For example: calling saveFile(newFile) can be used to implement a "Save As..." function. Note this method does not replace this SaveableFrame's file with the argument.
        cancellable - an optional argument. If non-null then this method needs to constantly poll this object to see if the user indicated they wanted to cancel this operation. In that case this method should wrap up as cleanly as possible and throw a UserCancelledException
        Throws:
        UserCancelledException - if the user cancelled this operation
        java.lang.Exception - if an unknown problem came up saving.

      • tryToClose

        public boolean tryToClose()
                   throws UserCancelledException
        If true then the user saved their changes as this method was called. If false then the user did not choose to save anything, or there was nothing to save. This may also throw a UserCancelledException
        Returns:
        Throws:
        UserCancelledException

      • doSaveAs

        protected java.io.File doSaveAs()
                         throws UserCancelledException,
                                java.lang.Exception
        This should be called on the EDT
        Returns:
        the File that was saved.
        Throws:
        UserCancelledException
        java.lang.Exception

      • showFileDialog

        protected java.io.File showFileDialog(int dialogMode,
                                      java.lang.String dialogTitle,
                                      java.io.File defaultFile,
                                      java.lang.String... documentFileExtension)
                               throws UserCancelledException
        Show a FileDialog.
        Parameters:
        dialogMode - must be FileDialog.LOAD or FileDialog.SAVE
        dialogTitle - the title of this dialog.
        defaultFile - an optional file to initially select.
        documentFileExtension - an optional extension to apply, or array of extensions to accept. This is used both as a file filter for this dialog and the zeroeth element is manually appended to the filename if necessary during a save. It is OK to leave this null/empty for an open dialog, but it is highly discouraged to leave this null for a save dialog.
        Returns:
        the File the user chose.
        Throws:
        UserCancelledException - if the user cancelled this dialog.

      • showSaveDialogAndDoSave

        protected void showSaveDialogAndDoSave(java.io.File file)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        This is called on the EDT to save to a File. This pulls up an indeterminate progress bar dialog with a cancel button while the save operation is in progress.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
